abstract.p: Amberley Castle in southern England, which has been converted to country hotel, offers Ferrari Driving Weekend, November 3 to 5, during which guests will take turns driving five different Ferraris on local roads (S)

block.p: How often do most people get to drive a Ferrari? How about five of them? Amberley Castle, a 12th-century castle in southern England that is now a country hotel, is offering a Ferrari Driving Weekend Nov. 3 to 5. Participants will take turns driving five different Ferraris on local roads: a 1972 246 GTS Dino, a 1986 308 GTS, a 1988 328 GTS, a 1990 348 TS and a 1996 355 GTS. The weekend costs $1,252 a person, double occupancy (at $1.52 to the pound), and includes daily breakfast and dinner. The castle, built in 1103, is in the Sussex Downs area of West Sussex and has 15 rooms and 5 suites. Call Bespokes car rental at (44-1923) 250 250.

Finding an errant golf shot among the gorse and pot bunkers at most Scottish links courses is tough enough; finding the courses themselves shouldn't be as difficult. And it isn't, now that the Scottish Tourist Board has come up with a free map locating more than 300 golf courses in Scotland.

The full-color folding map is useful just as a motorist's guide to Scotland, but it also includes postal and e-mail addresses, telephone and fax numbers, amenities, approximate greens fees and thumbnail descriptions of all the courses, along with information on golf passes that could save a player money. For the Golf Scotland map, call the tourist board at (44-8705) 511 511.

Lee Iacocca, the retired automobile executive, gave the world the Mustang and the minivan. Now he's focusing on a more modest development: the E-Bike, which can be rented in Palm Springs, Calif., at the two Marriott hotels and the Hyatt Grand Champions. A 24-volt rechargeable battery system powers the bike when riders tire. It can reach 30 miles an hour, and has a range of 20 miles. Rates are $50 a day or $10 an hour; call (800) 417-3529 for Palm Springs information.
